title: Desenvolvedor(A) Fullstack Sênior
description:
A aquarela está em busca de um(a) Desenvolvedor(a) Fullstack Sênior apaixonado(a) por criar soluções web ponta a ponta. Nesse papel, você atuará tanto no front-end quanto no back-end de projetos inovadores, utilizando tecnologias modernas (TypeScript/JavaScript – React, Next.Js, Node.Js – e Python) para impulsionar nossas soluções de IA e Analytics em um ambiente ágil e colaborativo.Requisitos:
Sólida experiência em desenvolvimento fullstack, atuando no front-end (React, Next.Js) e back-end de aplicações webDomínio de JavaScript/TypeScript e padrões de projeto, com forte conhecimento em React e Next.Js no front-endExperiência em desenvolvimento de APIs e serviços backend (utilizando Node.Js e/ou Python), incluindo integração com bancos de dados relacionais e NoSQLFamiliaridade com arquitetura de software escalável, consumo de APIs RESTful/GraphQL e boas práticas de versionamento de código (Git)Compromisso com qualidade:
escrever código limpo, bem documentado, coberto por testes automatizados e aderente a práticas de CI/CDInglês intermediário para leitura de documentação técnica e comunicação no dia a dia de trabalhoResponsabilidades:
Desenvolver e manter aplicações web completas, abrangendo desde interfaces de usuário em React/Next.Js até APIs e lógicas de negócio no backendProjetar arquiteturas de software escaláveis e seguras, garantindo alta performance, qualidade e manutenibilidade dos sistemasImplementar e promover boas práticas de engenharia de software, incluindo código limpo, testes unitários/integração, code reviews e integração/entrega contínuaColaborar de forma próxima com times multidisciplinares (Produto, Design, Data Science) para definir requisitos, propor soluções técnicas e entregar novas funcionalidades de alto valorMentorar desenvolvedores juniores e plenos, atuando como referência técnica, compartilhando conhecimento e contribuindo para o crescimento do timeIdentificar e resolver problemas complexos de software, realizando depuração avançada e otimização de performance tanto no front-end quanto no backend, assegurando excelente experiência do usuárioDiferenciais:
Vivência com práticas de DevOps e pipelines de CI/CD (integração contínua/entrega contínua), facilitando deploys ágeis e segurosExperiência com serviços de computação em nuvem (AWS) e ferramentas de containerização/deploy (como Coolify ou Docker/Kubernetes)Contribuições em projetos open source ou participação ativa em comunidades tech (meetups, conferências), demonstrando iniciativa e paixão pela áreaFormação superior em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Software ou áreas correlatasCultura focada em inovação, colaboração e respeito mútuo – buscamos profissionais que se identifiquem com esses valores e que tenham perfil proativo, com vontade de aprender e compartilhar conhecimento continuamenteModelo de trabalho:
Local de trabalho:
modelo híbrido para profissionais em Salvador (BA) ou Florianópolis (SC);
possibilidade de trabalho remoto para as demais regiões do BrasilRegime de contratação:
PJ ou CLT, à escolha do candidato, conforme sua preferênciaBenefícios:
pacote de benefícios negociável, de acordo com as necessidades do profissional (a ser discutido durante a proposta)Remuneração:
faixa salarial em aberto, negociada conforme a experiência e pretensões do candidato (oferecemos remuneração competitiva)Horário:
flexibilidade de horário com foco em entrega de resultados e qualidade do trabalhoComo se candidatar:
Interessados(as) devem enviar currículo atualizado e, se possível, link do portfólio/projetos (GitHub, ou similares) para o e-mail , com o assunto "Vaga Desenvolvedor(a) Fullstack Sênior - (Seu Nome)". Estamos animados para conhecer seu talento!

title: Arquiteto Oracle Otc
description:
Venha para uma das maiores empresas de Serviços IT do mundo!! Aqui você pode transformar sua carreira!Por que fazer parte da TCS? Aqui na TCS acreditamos que as pessoas fazem a diferença, por isso vivemos uma cultura de aprendizado ilimitado cheio de oportunidades de melhorias e desenvolvimento mútuo. Noções de boas práticasem gestão de projetos (PMBOK, Scrum, metodologias ágeis, etc.);

title: Associate, Risk Management Analyst
description:
No BNY, nossa cultura impulsiona seu crescimento e sucesso. Somos uma empresa global, líder em serviços financeiros que, atuando no centro do sistema financeiro mundial, atinge quase 20% dos ativos investíveis do mundo. Todos os dias, em todo o mundo, os nossos mais de 50.000 colaboradores trazem o poder da sua perspectiva única para criar soluções com os nossos clientes que beneficiam empresas, comunidades e pessoas em todo o mundo.O BNY permanece líder na indústria, premiado como destino certo para inovadores e por criar um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo. Através das nossas ideias e talentos únicos, juntos ajudamos a fazer o dinheiro trabalhar para o mundo. É sobre isso #LifeAtBNY.Estamos procurando um profissional para o time na função de Associate, Risk Management Analyst para se juntar à nossa equipe de Market Risk Management. Esta função está localizada no Rio de Janeiro, RJ - HÍBRIDO.Nesta função, você causará impacto das seguintes maneiras:
O profissional participará da execução das rotinas operacionais, desenvolvimento de relatórios customizados, análise crítica de relatórios de risco, participação em comitês internos e atendimento ao cliente.Para ter sucesso nesta função, buscamos o seguinte:
Graduação em Administração, Ciência da Computação, Economia, Engenharia, Estatística ou Matemática;
Experiência comRisco;
Conhecimento emVBA, SQL, Python, Power BI;
Capacidade analítica;
Excelentes habilidades de gerenciamento de tempo, multi-tarefas, organização e comunicação;
Inglês avançado;
Conhecimento do mercado de fundos de investimento.No BNY, nossa cultura inclusiva fala por si. Veja alguns de nossos prêmios:
O BNY oferece remuneração, benefícios e programas de bem-estar altamente competitivos, baseados em uma forte cultura de excelência e em nossa filosofia de remuneração por desempenho. Fornecemos acesso a recursos e ferramentas globais flexíveis para a jornada da sua vida. Concentre-se em sua saúde, promova sua resiliência pessoal e alcance suas metas financeiras como um membro valioso de nossa equipe, juntamente com licenças remuneradas que podem apoiar você e sua família em momentos importantes.BNY é um Empregador de Oportunidades Iguais de Emprego/Ação Afirmativa - Grupos raciais e étnicos sub-representados/Mulheres/Indivíduos com Deficiências.Locations:

title: Pessoa Analista Ppo Sênior – Ênfase Em Dados
description:
Job descriptionAQUI SUA CARREIRA COMEÇA GRANDE.VENHA SER UMA PESSOA ANALISTA PPO SÊNIOR – ÊNFASE EM DADOS NA YDUQS.Temos um projeto grandioso que requer uma equipe com disposição para pensar de forma original, disruptiva e com o objetivo de resolver as principais questões atuais na educação:
acesso, tecnologia, customização e sucesso dos nossos alunos.Somos uma companhia cheia de energia, que nasceu gigante e já apresenta resultados extraordinários.Venha fazer parte desse time!VENHA TRANSFORMAR VIDAS. INCLUSIVE A SUA.Main responsibilitiesOs principais desafios como PESSOA ANALISTA PPO SÊNIOR – ÊNFASE EM DADOS são:
Liderar a coleta, modelagem e análise de grandes volumes de dados operacionais e financeiros.Desenvolver análises avançadas que apoiem a melhoria contínua de processos e eficiência operacional.Construir dashboards e ferramentas analíticas focadas em indicadores de performance (KPIs) e tendências.Atuar como referência técnica em análise de dados dentro do time, promovendo boas práticas de modelagem e visualização.Colaborar com áreas de negócio e tecnologia para garantir governança, qualidade e integridade dos dados utilizados nas análises.Identificar oportunidades de automação e otimização de rotinas analíticas e operacionais.Atuar em ambientes complexos com grande volume de dados.Requirements and skillsBuscamos profissionais com:
Ensino superior completo em Administração, Economia, Engenharia, Estatística, Ciências de Dados ou áreas correlatas.Sólida experiência em planejamento financeiro ou operacional, com foco em indicadores de performance.Experiência com análise de dados e construção de relatórios/dashboards.Excel e PowerPoint avançados.Conhecimento em Power BI ou ferramentas similares de visualização de dados.Experiência prática com ferramentas e linguagens de análise e manipulação de dados:
SQL, Databricks, Python ou R.Additional informationLocal de Trabalho:
Barra da Tijuca, RJHorário de Jornada:
09h às 19h de segunda a quinta e das 09h às 18h às sextasNa YDUQS você vai encontrar:
Bolsas de estudo de até 100% para colaboradores, dependentes legais e agregados (pais, mães e irmãos), permitindo até três bolsas simultâneas.Assistência médica com subsídio integral para o colaborador e parcial para sua família, com o colaborador responsável pela coparticipação.Assistência odontológica opcional para cuidar da saúde bucal.Vale Alimentação ou Vale Refeição com opções para se adequar às suas necessidades.Wellhub ou Totalpass para opções flexíveis de academias.Programa de bem-estar e clube de vantagens com benefícios exclusivos.Dress code flexível para promover a diversidade.Seguro de vida.Convênio com o SESC.Universidade Corporativa no portal Educare.Oportunidades de crescimento, com mais de 60% das vagas preenchidas por processos internos.Modelo de trabalho híbrido para todos os escritórios da companhia.Trabalho remoto (home office) estendido para mães e pais recém-saídos da licença maternidade ou paternidade por até 3 meses, dependendo da função.Acreditamos na excelência do nosso ensino e valorizamos os egressos das nossas instituições em nossos processos seletivos.Mais inclusão:
esta vaga também é destinada a pessoas com deficiência.DIVERSIDADE:
A YDUQS valoriza a diversidade e as informações adicionais fornecidas nos campos de diversidade são muito importantes para nós. Por isso, pedimos que não deixe de responder.#J-18808-Ljbffr

description:

title: Governanta (Com Experiência)
description:
Quem Somos? Bem-vindo ao Universo El MistiNo El Misti Hostels & Pousadas, acreditamos que tudo compartilhado é muito melhor. Há mais de 24 anos, unimos amor por viagens, pessoas e cultura para transformar sonhos em experiências inesquecíveis. Somos mais que um lugar para dormir — somos um ponto de encontro entre pessoas do mundo inteiro e a energia vibrante do Rio de Janeiro.Nossa MissãoOferecer mais do que hospedagem:
criamos conexões genuínas entre hóspedes, equipe, a cidade maravilhosa e causas sociais. Somos apaixonados por servir e encantar, e cada detalhe da jornada do hóspede é planejado para ser memorável.Por Que Trabalhar Conosco?Trabalhar no El Misti é entrar para uma tribo apaixonada, diversa e comprometida com:
- Amor pelo que faz- Trabalho em equipe de verdade- Respeito e empatia em todas as relações- Aprendizado contínuo- Inovação com propósitoAqui, valorizamos cada pessoa que soma com nosso propósito. Investimos em capacitação, feedbacks constantes e oportunidades reais de crescimento. Sabemos que quando você cresce, a empresa cresce com você.A Magia que Nos MoveInspirados pelo modelo Disney de atendimento, acreditamos que todos têm um papel essencial na criação da magia. Nosso atendimento vai além da expectativa:
entregamos experiências. E tudo começa compessoas encantadoras como você.O Que Esperamos de Você?Buscamos pessoas que:
- Têm brilho nos olhos e energia positiva- Sabem se comunicar com empatia- Curtem trabalhar em equipe e servir com alegria- Aprendem rápido, erram pequeno e acertam grande- Agem com responsabilidade e sentem orgulho do que entregamLOCALIZAÇÃOIpanema, Rio de Janeiro/RJCONTRATOCLT (Efetivo)DESCRIÇÃOCoordenar as atividades de arrumação diária, assim como os responsáveis por cada função.Planejar as atividades de faxina, a fim de manter as áreas de circulação e sociais sempre em bom estado de higiene, conservação e limpeza;
Organizar compras de insumos, desde equipamentos de limpeza até os materiais para os apartamentos;
Cuidar da escala de folga dos funcionários;
Realizar a inspeção do trabalho realizado;
Cuidar dotreinamento daequipe;
Controlar a seção de achados e perdidos;
Manter um inventario;
Controlar o estoque, orçamentos e os custos;
Preencher relatórios.REQUISITOSExperiência comprovávelPrö-atividadeDedicaçãoOrganizaçãoResponsabilidadeEspírito de liderançaCordialidadePontualidadeSaber se comunicar com clarezaTer senso crítico apuradoTipo de vaga:

title: Técnico Mecânico
description:
Venha para uma das maiores empresas de Serviços TI do mundo!! Aqui você pode transformar sua carreira! Por que fazer parte da TCS? Aqui na TCS acreditamos que as pessoas fazem a diferença, por isso vivemos uma cultura de aprendizado ilimitado cheio de oportunidades de melhorias e desenvolvimento mútuo. O cenário ideal para expandir ideias através das ferramentas certas, contribuindo para nosso sucesso num ambiente colaborativo. Procuramos Técnico Mecânico com 10 anos de experiência ou mais com CFT ativo que queira aprender e transformar sua carreira. Requisitos:
Planejador de Manutenção:
Identificar e revisar demandas de manutenção. Planejar serviços de manutenção. Elaborar carteiras de serviços de manutenção. Confirmar e encerrar registros de serviços de manutenção. Especificar e solicitar materiais. Solicitar revisão de cadastro de equipamentos, locais de instalação e planos de manutenção. Técnico de Materiais:
Determinar todas as características técnicas e comerciais necessárias para cadastrar cada material sobressalente identificado, conforme os requisitos do PDM utilizado no módulo MM do ERP SAP utilizado pelo cliente. Identificar a classe que será usada para cadastrar o material, obedecendo aos critérios especificados no padrão de Cadastramento de Materiais Sobressalentes utilizado em Buzios/Produção. Contactar o fabricante ou representante comercial caso exista alguma dúvida sobre as informações solicitadas pelo PDM selecionado no módulo MM do ERP SAP utilizado pelo cliente Caso o PDM atual não permita a identificação unívoca do material ou existam dúvidas em relação à pertinência ou ausência de alguma característica técnica do material, deve ser aberta uma solicitação de revisão do PDM. Avaliar e ajustar o cadastro de materiais presentes no módulo MM do ERP SAP utilizado pelo cliente, incluindo parâmetros de ressuprimento, especificação técnica e tratamento de duplicações de cadastro. Avaliar se o cadastro atual do material contém as informações mínimas necessárias e todas as informações não obrigatórias que também estão disponíveis.. Tratar todas as divergências de cadastro identificadas, enviando junto com a solicitação de alteração do NM, os documentos que embasaram as solicitações de ajuste. Avaliar os parâmetros de estoque e ressuprimento em relação ao histórico de consumo do NM em cada depósito. Preparar planilha para ajuste dos parâmetros de Centro, de Área de MRP e de Depósito, identificando os motivos da solicitação. Formação:
Formação em curso técnico mecânica. Conhecimentos:
Conhecimento intermediário de pacote Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook e Teams). Conhecimento intermediário do módulo PM do SAP. Conhecimento intermediário do módulo MM do SAP. Desejável experiência em planejamento e programação de manutenção, principalmente offshore. Experiência em especificação de materiais de manutenção. O que você pode esperar de nós? - Desenvolvimento profissional e evolução constante das suas competências, sempre de acordo com os seus interesses.
- Oportunidades para trabalho fora do Brasil - Um ambiente colaborativo, diverso e inovador, que incentiva o trabalho em equipe. O que oferecemos? Benefícios TCS – Brasil - Plano de Saúde;
- Planos Odontológico;
- Seguro de Vida;
- Vale Transporte;
- Vale Refeição/Alimentação;
- Auxílio Creche;
- Gympass;
- TCS Cares – 0800 gratuito que fornece assistência psicológica (24 hrs/dia), jurídica, social e financeira aos associados;
- Parceria comSESC;
- Reembolso deCertificações;
- Portal de aprendizagem gratuito da TCS – cursos online e treinamentos ao vivo;
- Oportunidadede experiência internacional;
- Parceria de Descontos com Universidades e Escolas de Idiomas;
- Bring Your Buddy – Ao indicar pessoas você se torna elegível a receber um bônus para cada contratação;
- TCS Gems – Reconhecimento por performance;
- Xcelerate – Plataforma de carreira com mentoria gratuita. Na TATA Consultancy Services promovemos uma cultura inclusiva, trabalhamos sempre pela equidade. Isso se aplica em Gênero, Pessoas com Deficiência, LGBTQIA+, Religião, Raça, Etnia, ou seja, todas as nossas oportunidades são trabalhadas com esses princípios. Pensamos em ações diversas de inclusão e de responsabilidade social, a fim de construir uma TCS que respeita a individualidade. Seja um TCSer! ID:

description:

title: Mecanico B
description:
UMA EMPRESA BRASILEIRA, FEITA DE TALENTOS, PAIXÃO, MUITO ENTUSIASMO E DESAFIOS!Oi, somos a VAMOS! Um ecossistema único em alternativas para a renovação e expansão da frota brasileira. Com isso, desenvolvemos nosso negócio diariamente em cima de dois pilares:
renovar e inovar, contribuindo sempre para melhorar a performance e aumentar a rentabilidade dos nossos clientes.Nossa jornada é movida pela responsabilidade com nosso CLIENTE, pelo comprometimento com a nossa GENTE, pela SIMPLICIDADE do nosso jeitão de ser e realizar, pela QUALIDADE dos nossos produtos e serviços, tendo o LUCRO como garantia da renovação dos nossos ciclos.Buscamos pessoas que apresentam simplicidade, paixão por servir e que tenham interesse em aprender, desafiar-se e desenvolver-se junto ao crescimento da empresa. Se você tem esse perfil e quer trabalhar em um local em que a nossa Gente faz a diferença, confira nossas vagas ou cadastre seu currículo em nosso banco de talentos.Todos os processos seletivos conduzidos pela VAMOS são afirmativos, inclusivos e não discriminatórios.Responsabilidades e atribuiçõesIdentificar falhas de componentes mecânicos;
Realizar orçamento, fazer diagnóstico de falhas através de scanner;
Realizar revisões, Check List e fazer anotações com as ações necessárias para solução dos problemas e garantir e atestar a qualidade dos reparos executados.Requisitos e qualificaçõesDesejável ensino médio completo;
Desejável cursona área de mecânica diesel;
Conhecimento básico em informática;
Experiência na área de mecânica diesel;
Possuir fácil acesso à região de PORTO REAL- RJ;
Informações adicionaisGENTE É O NOSSO NEGÓCIO E É POR ISSO QUE VALORIZAMOS NOSSOS COLABORADORES DE DIVERSAS FORMAS!Os benefícios tradicionais que você já conhece, nós também temos. Queremos te mostrar que vamos além. Saiba mais!LIGADO EM VOCÊ:
Atendimento especializado para a nossa gente e familiares por meio de uma central 24 horas para apoio psicológico, sobre saúde, social, familiar, financeiro e/ou jurídico e tudo isso com sigilo absoluto.Licença Maternidade e Paternidade estendidas + Kit nascimento para recém-mamães e recém-papais.Sabemos o quanto a educação das crianças e adolescentes é importante. Aqui na VAMOS, damos aquela ajuda na compra do kit escolar para os filhos da nossa gente.Nossa gente tem acesso exclusivo a uma plataforma de descontos em viagens, cultura e entretenimento, serviços, gastronomia, educação e bem-estar.Pela Universidade VAMOS, a nossa gente aprende e potencializa seu desenvolvimento profissional, tornando cada um(a) protagonista de sua carreira.Sonha em ser voluntário(a)? Faça parte do VAMOS Fazer o Bem, onde nossos colaboradores geram impactos positivos por meio de pequenas ações.Reconhecemos e valorizamos a nossa gente veterana que completa anos de casa. Quem possui mais de 15 anos, ainda tem um evento mega especial.Cantinho da Mamãe:
O espaço, na Matriz no Itaim Bibi e Sede Administrativa em Mogi das Cruzes, é dedicado as mamães que retornam de licença maternidade e querem seguir com o aleitamento materno. No local, há todos os itens para retirar e armazenar o leite, com privacidade e conforto.Se identificou com essa vaga? Conheça as nossas vagas, inscreva-se e vamos juntos participar dessa Empresa que cresce todos os dias.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Especialista Em Compliance
description:
Apoiar no desenvolvimento de estratégias e na implantação de processos que garantam a conformidade das empresas signatárias do Programa de Compliance do Grupo Guanabara com leis, regulamentos e normas internas e externas, visando eliminar ou mitigar riscos legais e operacionais inerentes às atividades do grupo.Desafios do Cargo:
Desenvolver políticas e diretrizes internas:
Criar e apoiar a implementação do código de conduta/ética da empresa, além de realizar treinamentos para promover programas de compliance em suas diferentes vertentes.Monitoramento e auditoria:
Acompanhar processos internos para assegurar conformidade com regulamentos das atividades das empresas do Grupo Guanabara.Gestão de riscos:
Identificar, avaliar e mitigar riscos de compliance, sugerindo planos de ação eficazes para eliminar ou reduzir esses riscos.Condução de investigações internas:
Gerenciar denúncias e investigações de irregularidades, incluindo o atendimento às alegações, condução de apurações e elaboração de planos de ação, com o apoio de representantes de compliance nas empresas do grupo.Requisitos Obrigatórios:
Formação superior completa em Administração, Economia ou Contabilidade.Experiência em Áreas de Governança, Riscos e Conformidade (GRC), com participação direta em processos financeiros (contas a pagar/receber, fluxo de caixa, conciliações).Experiência em auditoria de rotinas financeiras e avaliações de conformidade, incluindo levantamento de processos, avaliação de riscos, elaboração de planos de ação, follow-ups, elaboração de relatórios e dashboards.Certificação em Power Apps e Power Query.Conhecimento em Microsoft Power BI, Office 365, Power Platform, AI Builder e ChatGPT.Requisitos Desejáveis:
Pós-graduação em Gestão Empresarial, Finanças, Compliance, Auditoria ou áreas relacionadas.Conhecimento em técnicas de apuração de denúncias, certificações como CFE, CCEP, CPC-A, ISO 19600 e ISO 37001.Experiência com banco de dados SQL, criação de dashboards de auditoria, elaboração e revisão de normativos internos.Conhecimentos em Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP, IA Generativa, Git, Python, Azure, AML, DataBricks, PySpark, DevOps e MLOps.#J-18808-Ljbffr

description:

Liderar, motivar e acompanhar a performance da equipe comercial. Execução Comercial:
Implementar estratégias de vendas e apoiar negociações. Relacionamento e fidelização de clientes.A TECH FIRE BRASIL é uma empresa especializada em consultoria e soluções em fire protection para empresas e indústrias de todos os segmentos. Nosso trabalho consiste em analisar e oferecer soluções adequadas.Realizar exames de ultrassonografia em animais na rotina e em emergências. Laudar, interpretar e relatar resultados de exames. Fazer atendimentos clínicos e participar de reuniões de equipe.Gerenciar a equipe de atendimento ao cliente. Responder às solicitações e reclamações dos clientes. Analisar métricas de desempenho e propor melhorias. Implementar estratégias para otimização do atendimento.Requisitos:
Conhecimento técnico em Sistemas de Segurança Eletrônica e Rede;
Gestão do tempo;
Compromisso com entrega e prazos;
Conhecimento técnico emsoftwares de controle de acesso.PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES:
Realizar manutenção de modo geral, de acordo com as necessidades diárias;
Manutenção e reparo de máquinas e equipamentos;
Criar e modificar processos de manutenção.PEOPLE RH em parceria com COOPERATIVA MÉDICA em Campinas está com vaga para TÉCNICO(A) DE ENFERMAGEM DO TRABALHO:
Atividades incluem auxílio a médicos em ambulatório e organização de documentos.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Artífice
description:
Profissional multifuncional responsável por realizar serviços de manutenção preventiva e corretiva, pequenos reparos e obras em instalações prediais, com ênfase em sistemas hidráulicos. Atua em diversas frentes como hidráulica, alvenaria, pintura e carpintaria, garantindo o bom funcionamento e a conservação das estruturas e equipamentos.Principais ResponsabilidadesExecutar manutenções hidráulicas em tubulações, registros, válvulas, caixas d’água, bombas e conexões, com domínio de sistemas como tubulação do tipo Barbará;
Efetuar pequenos reparos em estruturas físicas como paredes, pisos, portas, janelas e redes hidráulicas;
Realizarmanutenção preventiva e corretiva em instalações prediais, abrangendo áreas como alvenaria e pintura;
Montar einstalar itens diversos como móveis, prateleiras, divisórias, luminárias e demais equipamentos;
Realizarinspeções periódicas para identificar falhas, vazamentos ou necessidades de reparos nos sistemas hidráulicos e demais estruturas;
Apoiar em obras de pequeno porte, como preparação de superfícies, assentamento de pisos, pintura e acabamentos;
Responder a chamados demanutenção com agilidade, garantindo qualidade na execução dos serviços;
Controlar o uso e a reposição de materiais, bem como o armazenamento adequado de ferramentas e equipamentos;
Zelar pela organização,limpeza e segurança do local de trabalho, seguindo as normas técnicas e de segurança, incluindo o uso obrigatório de EPIs.RequisitosEnsino médio completo ;
Amplo conhecimento em tubulações do tipo Barbará e leitura de plantas hidráulicas;
#J-18808-Ljbffr

Understanding and perform the roles and responsibilities as assigned at the pre-job meeting.Understanding the hazards associated with the task.Understanding and effectively implementing the control measures required to mitigate identified hazards.Execute all tasks and task steps in a disciplined manner, following the sequence detailed in the relevant procedures.Recognize at risk behavior or conditions during tasks and call ‘Time out for Safety’ when unsure, or when the job does not go as planned.Participate in After Action Reviews to feedback lessons learned from performing the task.Hse RequirementsDemonstrate commitment and leadership in the protection of personnel, the environment, and assets.Coach personnel in the understanding of applicable Company OI & HSE requirements.Ensure work is executed in accordance with Company OI & HSE requirements.Call a Time Out when a real or perceived at risk behavior or unsafe condition is observed.Coach personnel to use WorkSight ENGAGE during the execution of planned work.Use WorkSight COACH during the execution of planned work and daily operations to reinforce Company requirements.Report all incidents, potential hazards, or abnormal situations. Ensure reported situations are acknowledged properly.Ensure the Control of Work process is complied with when planning and managing the execution of work.Ensure major accident barriers / controls are maintained.Ensure safe and organized work areas are maintained.Understand your role in an emergency, as designated in the Emergency Response Plan and Station Bill.Lead or participate in all emergency drills and exercises, as required.Ensure change is properly controlled and managed.DutiesThe underlying expectation is that all duties are carried out in compliance with the Company Operational Discipline expectations and HSE requirements. When considering assignment of duties for the 2nd Assistant Engineer, the Supervisor and the 2nd Assistant Engineer will apply the Control of Work process to determine if the assigned role is appropriate. This means confirming that the individuals involved have the knowledge, skills, and experience to carry out the task, and the task plan complies with policy before they are authorized to proceed.Operations/MaintenanceGENERAL DUTIES:
Coordinate and ensure that all mechanical, pneumatic and hydraulic equipment maintenance and repair is done in a safe and prudent manner.Ensure conformance to policies, local and international regulations relating to the operation of the rig, and current pollution regulations.Monitor the power plants’ controls and power distribution;
ensure that power is available at all times.Ensure that the permit to work and isolation system is in place and followed.Participate in the effective management of the AIM (Asset & Inventory Management) system and ensure all records are maintained on a timely basis.Operate, maintain and repair as necessary the engine cooling water system, lube oil system, and fuel system.Supervise the maintenance and repair on all pumps and valves of the ballast system, thrusters, associated driven pumps and auxiliary equipment.Liaise with the marine department regarding the loading, ordering and use of fuel, potable water, and drill water in consideration of the rig’s stability.Carry out equipment periodic maintenance according to AIM guidelines and coordinate same with First Engineer.Ensure that reports for repair and maintenance of equipment are accurate and complete.Carry out classification society surveys as part of continuous survey of machinery.Assist the First Engineer in ensuring that all third-party equipment is fit for purpose, certified, correctly installed, and maintained while on the rig.In conjunction with the First Engineer, monitor and control the use and distribution of consumables/materials;
generate requisitions as required.Maintain an adequate supply of spares to fulfill maintenance requirements and facilitate a safe and efficient operation.Inform the First Engineer of any technical problems or limitations that may affect the safe operation of the rig.Implement outstanding recommendations from audits, as issued by Clients, Regulatory Authorities or rig management.Assist the First Engineer in supplying information for maintenance and repair budget.Assist in communicating equipment problems or breakdown with Field Support group and equipment vendors.PersonnelPromote and maintain good working relationships with other departments, third-party personnel and Customer representatives.Ensure all Maintenance personnel meet the training requirements as per their applicable training matrix.Mentor, coach, develop and train crew members to ensure they are competent to work at their next job level.Provide leadership and motivation to the maintenance crews. Apply continuous improvement process.Mentor the 3rd Assistant Engineer and deputize when operations, security of well, and personnel safety are not at risk.Assist in training to ensure that all personnel are competent to perform their allocated jobs.Participate fully in the annual performance appraisal process.Apply appropriate accountability regarding recognition;

title: Application Developer - Fullstack - Exclusive For Persons With Disabilities (Pwd)
description:
In this role, you'll work in one of our IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers (Delivery Centers), where we deliver deep technical and industry expertise to a wide range of public and private sector clients around the world. Our delivery centers offer our clients locally based skills and technical expertise to drive innovation and adoption of new technology.A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe.You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio;
including Software andRed Hat.Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in groundbreaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.Your Role and ResponsibilitiesAs a Software Developer, you'll participate in many aspects of the software development lifecycle, such as design, code implementation, testing, and support. You will create software that enables your clients' hybrid-cloud and AI journeys.Your primary responsibilities include:
Visionary Software Infrastructure Design and Development:
Envision, design, and build the software infrastructure that keeps the solutions running.Innovative Problem Solving for Efficient Solutions:
Challenge ideas, identify problems, and create efficient solutions.Flexible, Maintainable, and Scalable Application Components:

Collaborate with development peers and lead the way staying up to date with tools and technology trends.Required EducationTechnical DiplomaPreferred EducationBachelor's DegreeRequired Technical and Professional ExpertiseKnowledge of Java programming language;
Framework/containers:
Springboot and Docker;
Experience in web frontend development, with modern and componentized micro-frontend architectures:
Angular Frameworks.Preferred Technical and Professional ExperienceIBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market-leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration.Your Life @ IBMIn a world where technology never stands still, we understand that dedication to our clients' success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships live in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment every day, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason, and science, we can improve business, society, and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Other Relevant Job DetailsAll our positions are eligible for people with disabilities (PwD) or rehabilitated.Job Title:

title: Key Account Engineer
description:
We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Key Account Engineer to manage and expand relationships with our key clients. This role goes beyond traditional account management—it combines strategic client engagement, sponsor reporting, account growth initiatives, and hands-on engineering support.As a Key Account Engineer, you will act as the bridge between our clients and our engineering teams, ensuring seamless integration of Valiot’s AI-driven manufacturing solutions. You will be responsible for on-site client interactions at the plant, making this an ideal role for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, hands-on manufacturing environment.Key ResponsibilitiesClient Relationship ManagementBuild and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients.Act as the primary point of contact, ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and loyalty.Provide strategic guidance to clients, helping them maximize the value of our solutions.Sponsor ReportingPrepare and present detailed reports on project progress, performance metrics, and delivered value.Translate complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.Account ScalingIdentify opportunities to expand Valiot’s services within existing accounts.Work closely with sales and marketing teams to develop and implement account growth strategies.Project Management SupportAssist in planning and coordinating project activities to ensure on-time, high-quality execution.Monitor project milestones, proactively addressing any challenges that arise.Engineering & Technical SupportServe as the key liaison between clients and our engineering teams, ensuring technical requirements are met.Provide hands-on technical support and training on Valiot’s AI-driven automation solutions.Analyze manufacturing data to optimize operations and enhance client outcomes.QualificationsRequired:
Residence in Rio de Janeiro (Duque de Caxias) and/or Maringá is required, as the role is based at the client’s manufacturing facility.Fluency in Portuguese (native level) and advanced English.Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering or a related field.Proven experience in key account management, preferably within the manufacturing or technology sectors.Strong understanding of manufacturing operations and factory environments.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies.Preferred:
Experience in project management and engineering support roles.Familiarity with IoT, AI, and automation technologies in manufacturing.Strong analytical skills for interpreting complex data and driving informed decision-making.What We OfferCompetitive Salary – $2,150 USD/month as independent contractor.Flexible Time Off – We support work-life balance and trust our team to manage their time, as long as responsibilities are met and onsite presence is maintained.Career Growth – Join a rapidly growing tech startup where your contributions have a real impact.Cutting-Edge Innovation – Work hands-on with AI-powered automation solutions in the manufacturing industry.A Collaborative & Supportive Team – Work with experts in AI, automation, and manufacturing who are passionate about pushing boundaries.If you are passionate about technology, eager to grow personally and professionally, and excited to work in an innovative, high-impact environment, we want to hear from you!Send your CV to and be part of the future of AI-driven manufacturing.Seniority levelMid-Senior levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionSales and Business Development#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Solutions Consultant (Adobe Experience Platform)
description:
About the Role:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated AEP Solutions Consultant to join our Americas team. This is a strategic and technical role at the intersection of marketing technology and fan experience, especially within the fast-paced world of sports and entertainment. You will lead the design, development, and implementation of innovative Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) solutions tailored to our clients’ unique business needs, with a sharp focus on delivering measurable marketing impact and enhancing the fan journey across touchpoints. As a trusted advisor to both technical and business stakeholders, you’ll be expected to understand and translate marketing KPIs into actionable AEP configurations, channel and data activations, ensuring solutions not only perform but also drive growth, personalization and engagement—particularly within the context of the sports, where the fan experience is paramount. Key Roles & Responsibilities:
Architect and lead the delivery of complex AEP solutions that are scalable, future-proof, and aligned with client goals—particularly those tied to marketing KPIs such as fan acquisition, engagement, conversion, merchandise and ticket sales. Partner closely with stakeholders in sports and entertainment organizations to understand their fans' behaviors, journeys, and content consumption habits, and translate those insights into personalized, real-time AEP activations. Mentor and support junior engineers, providing guidance on best practices in AEP implementation, data design, and campaign orchestration.Drive the technical delivery of AEP projects end-to-end—ensuring on-time completion, high-quality outputs, and alignment with scope and budget. Stay current with evolving AEP capabilities and broader MarTech trends to help clients maintain a competitive edge in engaging fans across channels. Collaborate cross-functionally with project managers, strategists, and analytics teams to align technical execution with business objectives and measurable outcomes. Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. 5+ years of experience in marketing technology implementations, with deep hands-on expertise in Adobe Experience Platform and related tools such as Adobe Campaign, Adobe Target, and Adobe Analytics. Strong knowledge of marketing performance metrics and how to architect solutions that influence outcomes such as ROI, CLTV, churn, and campaign lift. Proven ability to lead technical teams, manage stakeholder expectations, and foster a collaborative delivery environment. Experience with data, segmentation, identity resolution, consent management, and journey building & personalization within AEP. Solid grasp of Agile methodologies and experience working in a dynamic, fast-paced setting.Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex concepts to both technical and business teams. Desirable skills:
Experience working with or supporting clients in the sports, media, or entertainment industries. Familiarity with fan engagement strategies, event-driven personalization, and omnichannel orchestration in a sports context. Integration experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and third-party data sources to enrich customer profiles. Understanding of audience segmentation, journey mapping, and how AEP can be leveraged to optimize the end-to-end fan experience. What We Offer:
Competitive salary and benefits package Opportunities for professional growth and development A collaborative, fast-paced, and forward-thinking environment where marketing meets technology Join Verticurl and lead the charge in shaping the future of marketing technology!

title: Implementations Project Manager, Fund Admin
description:
Implementations Project Manager, Fund AdminThe Company You’ll JoinCarta connects founders, investors, and limited partners through world-class software, purpose-built for everyone in venture capital, private equity and private credit.Carta’s fund administration platform supports nearly 7,000 funds and SPVs, representing $150B in assets under administration in venture capital and private equity. Trusted by more than 40,000 companies, Carta also helps private businesses in over 160 countries manage their cap tables, valuations, taxes, equity programs, compensation, and more.Together, Carta is creating the end-to-end ERP platform for private markets. Traditional ERP solutions don’t work for Private Funds. Private capital markets need a comprehensive software solution to replace outdated spreadsheets and fragmented service providers. Carta’s software for the Office of the Fund CFO does just that - it’s a new category of software to make private markets look more like public markets - a connected ERP for private capital.At Carta we create owners and make private markets liquid.We live in a world where some people live on the equity stack and enjoy exponential wealth growth and preferential tax treatment;
others live on the debtstack and may work their entire lives for a company and retire only with the cash they’ve managed to save from their paychecks. Our contribution to solving the wealth inequality problem is moving people from the debt stack (payroll) to the equity stack. By making it as easy to issue equity to employees as it is to put them on payroll, we can create more owners.At Carta, we are helpful, transparent, fair, and kind. We are relentless executors, unconventional thinkers, and masters of our craft.To learn more, here is what one of our investors wrote about leading our Series F.The Problems You’ll SolveAs an Implementations Project Manager, you will focus efforts on supporting new Investor Services customers in their journey into Carta services. You will drive operational excellence within our fast-growing Investor Services business by coordinating, facilitating and managing on-boarding activities that are critical to achieving success for both our customers and Carta within a tight deadline.Support new Fund Administration, Portfolio Insights, and Valuations' clients by on-boarding them onto Carta – i.E., implementation of client’s limited partners list, investments, capitalization table and securitiesExtract relevant information from operating agreements and subscription documents to upload limited partners to CartaAnalyze data thoroughly and precisely to maintain data integrity throughout the on-boarding processEffectively liaise between sales and Investor Services teams as the bridge post-sales through implementationCoordinate and manage multiple/simultaneous implementation projects by continually communicating with and motivating clientsContinuously look for ways to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the on-boarding processWork closely with product and engineering to improve the on-boarding experience for customersThe Impact You’ll HaveYou’ll play a critical role in the transformation of the financial services industry through partnering with our new clients and helping them implement our software. In this role you will be responsible for interacting with a fund’s back office (CFO, fund manager) to collect their historical data, provide advisory support, and ultimately deliver accurate data to both the client and internal stakeholders.About YouFrom sale close, to implementation, and continued customer success, the ideal Implementations Project Manager will exhibit excellent communication skills, a high degree of problem-solving, velocity, embracing change and will constantly seek ways to better their process to provide customers with a world-class on-boarding experience.Proven success in a project management capacityAbility to interpret a story through unstructured dataExperience working with financial data and informationGreat people skills – high degree of empathy and great communication skillsExperience working with clientsExperience in implementing and successfully managing small and large projects or initiatives with sustained, measurable successIncredible organizational skills, high attention to detail, and an ability to complete competing priorities quickly and autonomouslyPassionate, tactical, and direct, with an ambitious attitude and a proven history to go above and beyond baseline requirementsInterested in working with enterprise softwareCarta’s compensation package includes a market competitive salary, equity for all full time roles, exceptional benefits, and, for applicable roles, commissions plans. If you are located in New York, New York, our minimum cash compensation salary range for this role is $81,000 - $85,000 (if applicable, + commission). We are hiring for multiple levels and locations, so final offers may vary from the amounts listed based on geography, experience and expertise, and other factors.We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, connect with us via email at As a company, we value fairness, helpfulness, transparency, leadership and build our teams around these values. Check out our careers page to get to know us better as you think about your next step at Carta.Disclosures:
We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, please connect with the talent partner via email.Please note that all official communications from us will come from an @carta.Com or @carta-external.Com domain. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in aconfidential file.As set forth in Carta’s Equal Employment Opportunity policy,we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected group status under any applicable law.If you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.As a government contractor subject to the Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measurethe effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categoriesis as follows:
A "disabled veteran" is one of the following:
a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs;
or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service.An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.Select...Voluntary Self-Identification of DisabilityForm CC-305Page 1 of 1OMB Control Number 1250-0005Expires 04/30/2026Voluntary Self-Identification of DisabilityForm CC-305 Page 1 of 1 OMB Control Number 1250-0005 Expires 04/30/2026Why are you being asked to complete this form?We are a federal contractor or subcontractor. The law requires us to provide equal employment opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. We have a goal of having at least 7% of our workers as people with disabilities. The law says we must measure our progress towards this goal. To do this, we must ask applicants and employees if they have a disability or have ever had one. People can become disabled, so we need to ask this question at least every five years.Completing this form is voluntary, and we hope that you will choose to do so. Your answer is confidential. No one who makes hiring decisions will see it. Your decision to complete the form and your answer will not harm you in any way. If you want to learn more about the law or this form, visit the U.S. Department of Labor’s Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at .How do you know if you have a disability?A disability is a condition that substantially limits one or more of your “major life activities.” If you have or have ever had such a condition, you are a person with a disability. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:
Alcohol or other substance use disorder (not currently using drugs illegally)Autoimmune disorder, for example, lupus, fibromyalgia, rheumatoid arthritis, HIV/AIDSBlind or low visionCancer (past or present)Cardiovascular or heart diseaseCeliac diseaseCerebral palsyDeaf or serious difficulty hearingDiabetesDisfigurement, for example, disfigurement caused by burns, wounds, accidents, or congenital disordersEpilepsy or other seizure disorderGastrointestinal disorders, for example, Crohn's Disease, irritable bowel syndromeIntellectual or developmental disabilityMental health conditions, for example, depression, bipolar disorder, anxiety disorder, schizophrenia, PTSDMissing limbs or partially missing limbsMobility impairment, benefiting from the use of a wheelchair, scooter, walker, leg brace(s) and/or other supportsNervous system condition, for example, migraine headaches, Parkinson’s disease, multiple sclerosis (MS)Neurodivergence, for example, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), autism spectrum disorder, dyslexia, dyspraxia, other learning disabilitiesPartial or complete paralysis (any cause)Pulmonary or respiratory conditions, for example, tuberculosis, asthma, emphysemaShort stature (dwarfism)Traumatic brain injuryDisability Status Select...PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT:
According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Social Media Coordinator
description:
Social Media CoordinatorDescriptionAre you passionate about social media and ready to take the lead in crafting strategies that make a real impact? Do you love staying ahead of the latest trends and creating content that engages and resonates with diverse audiences? If this sounds like you, we want you on our team!At Rio & Learn, we’re seeking a Social Media Coordinator who will oversee the entire management of our social media presence. You’ll be responsible for planning, creating, and executing our content strategies across various platforms. In this role, you won’t just be behind the scenes;
we need someone who’s not afraid to step in front of the camera and encourage our staff, teachers, and students to participate in videos as well.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy across all platforms.Create, manage, and schedule engaging content, ensuring it aligns with current trends and audience preferences.Collaborate with staff, teachers, and students to create authentic and lively video content.Manage paid advertising campaigns on various platforms and optimize them based on algorithm updates and performance.Analyze KPIs to refine and improve social media performance.Keep up to date with AI tools to enhance content creation and engagement.Promote sales through effective use of social media channels.QualificationsProven experience in managing social media platforms including WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, and more.Proficiency in video editing and content creation.Strong understanding of social media algorithms and paid advertising.Native-level proficiency in English. A second or third language (Portuguese, German, French, or Spanish) is highly valued.Confident, outgoing, and comfortable appearing in and coordinating video content.Ability to adapt to trends and quickly implement creative strategies.Job BenefitsA competitive salary ranging from BRL 5,000 to 7,000 per month, based on experience and onsite availability.A dynamic and enjoyable work environment, just steps away from Copacabana beach.Opportunity to work with a diverse international student body and gain cultural insights.Career growth and recognition of your efforts and productivity.Job stability with a fixed salary and performance-based incentives.Dental plan, so you’re always ready to smile!Additional potential earnings of up to BRL 1,500 per month tied to company-wide performance.Free Portuguese classes to help you thrive in Rio!#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior R&D Subsea Engineer
description:
Domaine Recherche Innovation & DévelopptType de contrat:
CDIExpérience Minimum:
6 ans- As part of TotalEnergies company, this position is required to support the strategy in its technological ambition. Specifically, you will reinforce the deep offshore team to ensure the progress of Subsea Technologies. Flow-Assurance and correlated technologies connected to subsea processing is a key area to develop into the position.- The R&D in EP is a strategic tool for the TotalEnergies Group and its EP growth as well as the Strategic alliance with Petrobras.Job Dimensions:
- The primary responsibility of this position is to support the Lead Deep Offshore Engineer in his mission.- Participate in the follow-up / coordination / technology transfer of various collaborations / partnerships with Oil & Gas Companies.- Participate in the Technical Committees related to various collaborations / partnerships in the Deep-Water Segment.- Contribute to ensure active follow-up of HQ involvement in JIPs funded / co-funded by TotalEnergies under the lead Deep Offshore engineer supervision.- Contribute to the Coordination of people (workforce) (Specialists from E&P or eventually from other Group branches, Partners, Research Institutes, Universities, Engineering, sub-contractors, PhD students, end of cursus trainees, post-PhD) under TEPBR R&D Deep Offshore Lead supervision.- Contribute to ensure the compliance with ANP 1% obligation, fostering the maximization of its use in all R&D projects related to Deep-Water.- Contribute to ensure the satisfactory progress of the R&D projects under execution by Academia and Brazilian Companies.The employee shall perform his/her activities in compliance with the HSE Management System, aligned with One Maestro Principles and oriented to safeguard the integrity of people, bearing in mind to preserve the environment and resources by contributing to improve our energy efficiency and decarbonization of Company’s assets and reputation.- Coordinate and steer various R&D Programs related to the selected Technologies for TotalEnergies E&P’s needs. Selected technologies will include elements like Subsea developments, long subsea tieback, Deep / Ultra deep offshore, Architecture, Support structures, as required.- Represent TotalEnergies R&D under TEPBR R&D Deep Offshore Lead supervision / delegation in Research Consortia, Joint Industry Projects, Joint Testing Projects and external events.- Contribute to identify, propose, and develop R&D collaborations & projects with universities, laboratories, institutes, Providers... addressing TotalEnergies’ strategy.- Contribute to the preparation of budgets and funding application dossiers.- As applicable, supervise new incomers and less experienced persons under learning process in relevant R&D activities.- Develop and disseminate specialized knowledge in the team.- Monitor technology development by competition, vendors, and academia;
keep R&D informed on its impact.- Promote the Company’s reputation within the professional and academic community.- Issue timely R&D reports, meetings & conferences’ synthesis, work proposals and plans.- Contribute to ensure technology development / qualification for the projects co-financed to meet TotalEnergies’ requirements.- Participate to the follow-up / technology transfer of projects coordinated by TEPBR R&D.- Participate under the supervision of TEPBR R&D Deep Offshore Lead to the Management of operated projects’ completion on-time, within the allocated budget, and communicate the results.- Contribute under the supervision of TEPBR R&D Deep Offshore Lead to an effective interface particularly with the TotalEnergies Branch “OneTech” and its R&D teams (Pau, Paris and CDRs) and the Technical Lines. You can interface as well with Customer Lines (Paris, Pau) and with Affiliates when required, during the R&D activities and the evaluation/qualification activities.- HSE & Quality:
Ensure TEPBR compliance to the legislative and internal requirements relating to Health, Safety and Environment and that all R&D activities conducted in Brazil are carried out with fully acceptable level of HSE. Ensure that the requirements of the E&P Referential (Charters, Company Rules, and Specifications) and TEPBR's Company Management System CMS are complied with for all relevant disciplines.Accountabilities:
- Contribute under the supervision of TEPBR R&D Deep Offshore Lead to the R&D activities in accordance with the multi-year program defined and validated by the project manager, the program manager, with a multidisciplinary approach.- Contribute under the supervision of TEPBR R&D Deep Offshore Lead to the development of innovative solutions and the development of TotalEnergies' scientific expertise in line with the objectives of the R&D project and the transfer to the business lines.- MSc degree in engineering or related disciplines.- A minimum of 5 years’ experience related to Technology and Operations in R&D E&P and/or Project in subsea techno Flow Assurance themes, (i.E., Hydrates, Wax, Asphaltenes, Scales and Flow Modeling), knowledge and/or experience in SURF, SPS or Subsea Processing is required.- Excellent technical analysis, interpersonal, oral, and written communication, organization, and presentation skills.- Portuguese language is mandatory, fluency in English language is essential, and preferably some knowledge in French.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Assist Driller
description:
Join to apply for the Assist Driller role at TransoceanGet AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.Offshore Drilling GroupA Transocean está focada em ser o empregador favorito para a indústria de perfuração. Estamos nos desafiando a cada dia para impulsionar o desempenho da empresa por meio de avanços tecnológicos e paixão pelo nosso trabalho.Resumo do Perfil do Cargo“Sobre a Transocean”Esta posição também é aplicável para pessoas com deficiência.Reconhecemos que nosso pessoal é essencial para nos ajudar a atingir nossa visão, por isso promovemos uma cultura que incentiva, apoia e celebra a diversidade de todos os tipos. Ela alimenta nossa inovação e nos conecta mais perto de nossos clientes e das comunidades em que operamos.This position is also for people with disabilities. We recognize that our people are key to helping us achieve our vision, so we have fostered a culture that encourages.Candidatos qualificados são considerados e tratados igualmente durante todo o processo seletivo e eventual contratação sem distinção de raça, cor, religião, nacionalidade, cidadania, idade, estado civil, ascendência, deficiência física ou mental, condição médica, status militar ou de veterano, orientação sexual, identidade ou expressão de gênero, informação genética ou qualquer outra característica protegida por lei federal, estadual ou local.Equal Opportunity StatementQualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.Assist the Driller in operating drilling and mud circulating equipment as instructed in the well program and in accordance to Company policies and procedures.Actively promote Transocean Shared Values.Descrição do CargoReportingReports to:
DrillerSupervisionDerrickhand, Pumphand, and Floorhand, RoverPre-requisite/QualificationHigh School Diploma (U.S.)/ Proof of Completion of Formal Education or Relevant Craft Certificate (where applicable)Successful Military Discharge – Preferred for U.S.Graduate of Trade School or University where knowledge and training acquired are applicable to job requirements – PreferredValid medical examination and vaccination certificatesKnowledge of all technical calculations required for the safe operation within the drilling operations.Basic computer skillsValid well control certificate per the standard defined on the training matrix.General RequirementsPromotes a Safe and Respectful Work Environment:
Proactively promotes and Maintains a healthy respect for open and transparent dialogue between all levels of personnel.Demonstrates care for the safety and well-being of all personnel, at all times. Invests in each person to provide equal opportunity for development and advancement of those qualified, to fulfill their career objectives. Respects the dignity of all personnel and recognizes their merit.Attend and participate in all required Safety and Operational meetings.Participate fully in the annual performance appraisal process, competency assessments based on performance against Operational Discipline requirements.Complete company training requirements for the Assistant Driller job level as per the training matrix, including in local/regulatory requirements.If applicable, the duties and responsibilities in the safety case for this position must be observed.Full participation in emergency drills and respond to emergency situations as per assigned duties on the station bill.Norway Specific:
Responsible to follow up on the working environment within the rig department.Operational Discipline RequirementsDisciplined application and participation in the Task Planning & Risk Assessment Process.This is inclusive of:
Understanding and perform the roles and responsibilities as assigned at the pre-job meeting.Understanding the hazards associated with the task.Understanding and effectively implementing the control measures required to mitigate identified hazards.Execute all tasks and task steps in a disciplined manner, following the sequence detailed in the relevant procedures.Recognize at risk behavior or conditions during tasks and call ‘Time out for Safety’ when unsure, or when the job does not go as planned.Participate in After Action Reviews to feedback lessons learned from performing the task.Hse RequirementsDemonstrate commitment and leadership in the protection of personnel, the environment, and assets.Coach personnel in the understanding of applicable Company OI & HSE requirements.Ensure work is executed in accordance with Company OI & HSE requirements.Call a Time Out when a real or perceived at risk behavior or unsafe condition is observed.Coach personnel to use WorkSight ENGAGE during the execution of planned work.Use WorkSight COACH during the execution of planned work and daily operations to reinforce Company requirements.Report all incidents, potential hazards, or abnormal situations. Ensure reported situations are acknowledged properly.Ensure the Control of Work process is complied with when planning and managing the execution of work.Ensure major accident barriers / controls are maintained.Ensure safe and organized work areas are maintained.Understand your role in an emergency, as designated in the Emergency Response Plan and Station Bill.Lead or participate in all emergency drills and exercises, as required.Ensure change is properly controlled and managed.DutiesThe underlying expectation is that all duties are carried out in compliance with the Company Operational Discipline expectations and HSE requirements. When considering assignment of duties for the Assistant Driller, the Supervisor and the Assistant Driller will apply the rules of task planning (CAKES) to determine if the assigned role is appropriate. This means confirming that the individuals involved have the knowledge, skills, and experience to carry out the task, and the task plan complies with policy before they are authorized to proceed.Operations/MaintenanceGENERAL DUTIES:
Perform the drilling department’s daily checklists, i.E., QHSE checks, Derrick inspection, choke and mud manifold line ups, etc.Maintain accurate BHA record of tubular and tool dimensions (i.E., internal and external diameter, fish neck, handling profiles and serial numbers etc.).Calculate ton-miles on drilling line;
maintain an accurate logbook and advise the Driller on the need to slip and cut.Maintain an organized drilling equipment store and tubular and subs inventory.Maintain proper communication with the Driller, Toolpusher, and other department heads.Read and interpret various gauges and meters relating to the drilling operations;
assist the Driller in maintaining records and logs.Actively participate in pre-tour meeting with the drilling crew for all drilling operations.Assist and relieve the Driller at the Driller’s console during drilling operations.Assist with the preparation of equipment for impending drilling operations.Organize and supervise the drilling crews for all operations.Assist the Driller during an emergency or well control situation;
assist in the well killing operations.Assist in supervision of Preventive Maintenance carried out on drilling equipment.Assist in supervision of repairs on drilling and associated equipment.Assist in running and cementing casing strings, running and retrieving BOPs and risers, and other operations as directed by the Driller or Toolpusher.Monitor mud systems and supervise solids control equipment and mud mixing operation.Assist in the planning, organization and execution of rig move operations.Operate drilling and associated equipment as directed by the Driller, i.E., Top Drive System, mud pumps, BOP and Diverter controls, etc.Know the clients’ rules and Company procedures for well control and blowout prevention.Incorporate the THINK process into all tasks, whether working alone or as part of a team.Participate daily in START process.Ensure subordinate personnel are properly trained in the START process.Call a Time Out for Safety (TOFS) whenever an unplanned hazard or a change in the expected results is observed.Ensure all relevant safety procedures and practices are adhered to during drilling operations, in accordance to the Company QHSE manual.Report any incidents, potential hazards or abnormal situations to the Driller or Toolpusher.Actively participate in weekly safety meetings and pre-tour meetings as required, FOCUS Improvement Process, and all other Company safety management systems.Assist in conducting drilling operations safety drills as and when required.Demonstrate commitment to the Company’s safety policies through leadership and guidance.Ensure that a high standard of hygiene and housekeeping is maintained onboard the rig.Meet the training requirements according to the applicable training matrix.Participate in the annual performance appraisal process.Mentor, coach, develop and train crew members to ensure that they are competent to work at their next job level.Provide leadership and motivation to rig personnel;
Apply continuous improvement process.Assist in training to ensure that all personnel are competent to perform their allocated jobs.Promote and maintain a good working relationship with other departments, third-party personnel and Customer Representatives.Promote and maintain a good working relationship with other departments, third-party personnel and Customer Representatives.Assist the Driller with the operation during the running and retrieving of marine risers, BOP and auxiliary equipment.PersonnelPromote and maintain good working relationships with other departments, third-party personnel and Customer representatives.Ensure all Drilling personnel meet the training requirements as per their applicable training matrix.Mentor, coach, develop and train crew members to ensure they are competent to work at their next job level.Provide leadership and motivation to the drilling crews. Apply continuous improvement process.Assist in training to ensure that all personnel are competent to perform their allocated jobs.Participate fully in the annual performance appraisal process.Apply appropriate accountability regarding recognition;
recommend promotion ordisciplinary action up to and including discharge.Se você deseja alcançar grandes conquistas, deixe a Transocean desenvolver sua carreira.Seniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionManagement and ManufacturingIndustriesOil and GasReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at Transocean by 2xSign in to set job alerts for “Assistant Driller” roles.We’re unlocking community knowledge in a new way. Experts add insights directly into each article, started with the help of AI.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Vip Account Managers Latam-Sao Paulo And Rio De Janeiro
description:
Company DescriptionSports betting, gaming and interactive entertainment is changing, and we’re leading that change. By putting people first. By placing exciting, engaging and entertaining experiences at more fingertips than ever before. We're pulling into pole position by pushing boundaries further. With innovation. With technology. But most importantly, with people like you. Because when you join Entain, it’s your game. So let’s win together.Job DescriptionAs a VIP Account Manager LATAM you will be responsible for you will be responsible for building a personal relationship with selected customers who have already passed the sustainability and RG risk criteria.The customer should feel comfortable with discussing any issue with you, including but not limited to responsible gaming, bonuses, revenue and source of funds. In addition, the role will provide our hosted customers with an end-to-end service from issue resolution, bonus, relationship and hospitality management.The aim is the VIP Account Manager to become the main point of contact between the company and the customer. This will involve a mixture of social responsibility and responsible gaming, adherence to the Code of Conduct and revenue growth by maximizing the share of the players gambling wallet against competitors.This role will need relationships to be built via telephone, email, chat and meeting customers personally through events and one-to-one meetings. You will also act as the first, and preferably, only point of escalation for any of your portfolio’s customers.We are currently looking for 2 VIP Account Managers. One will be located in SaoPaulo and the other located in Rio de JaneiroQualificationsWhat you will do:
Build a proactive and personalized relationship with allocated playersEnsure regulatory requests can be completed when requiredPartake in the strategic ambition of the account management team to drive growth and revenue to ultimately build loyalty to the brandConduct all responsible gambling and AML interactions with account customers where possibleIdentify potential new account customers via daily business analysis and reportingHandle/resolve customer issues /dispute resolutions ensuring the customer feels valueWork as an integral part of the account management team to influence player activity with a view to maximize retentionEnsure that clear communications into and out of the team to ensure we deliver a leading service to our customers and relevant feedback to the product and marketing teamsCoordinating with the hospitality team for the organization of events and to optimize the hospitality experience – attend these events with your customersProvide the business stakeholders with accurate reporting on performance, Responsible Gambling and growth of the account customer baseEnsure the spirit of the Code of Conduct is followed and adhered to in all interactions with our customersAdditional InformationMandatory requirementsMinimum of 1-3 years of experience managing VIPs in an online gaming or similar customer-centric environment, with a proven track record of managing high-value accounts.Native Portuguese speakerFluency in EnglishProven track record of customer revenue analysis and reportingOutstanding personal relationship management skillsAbility to work in a self-contained / independent environment knowing when to escalate and when to make your own decisions.You will have a high interest and good all-around knowledge of licensed online gaming in both sports and casinoCommunicate over phone, email and in person in a clear and engaging professional mannerExperience in hosting VIP events (preferred)Competencies / behavioursTeam PlayerCommercial skillsDrives ResultsInterpersonal SkillsAt Entain, we know that signing top players requires a great starting package, and plenty of support to inspire peak performance. Join us, and a competitive salary is just the beginning.Depending on your role and location, you can expect to receive benefits likeA regular bonusHealthcare supportA stake in our success through our ShareSave schemeGreat development opportunitiesWellbeing support, and so much more.And outside of this, you’ll have the chance to turn recognition from leaders and colleagues into amazing prizes, join a winning team of talented people and be a part of an inclusive and supporting community where everyone is celebrated for being themselves.Should you need any adjustments or accommodations to the recruitment process, at either application or interview, please contact us.At Entain, we do what's right. It's one of our core values and that's why we're taking the lead when it comes to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive future - for our people, and the wider global sports betting and gaming sector. However you identify, our ambition is to ensure our people across the globe feel valued, respected and their individuality celebrated.We comply with all applicable recruitment regulations and employment laws in the jurisdictions where we operate, ensuring ethical and compliant hiring practices globally.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Salesforce Analyst
description:
At Intellias, we're always on the lookout for exceptional talent to join our team in Brasil. Over 20 years of market experience, Intellias brings together technologists, creators and innovators in Europe, North and Latin America, and the Middle East. Join our international team and take the mission to solve the advanced tech challenges of tomorrow!If you're enthusiastic about contributing your skills and experience to our organization, we invite you to submit your CV for this position.What we offer you in ColombiaContractor with Intellias, payment in USDTraining and certifications100% work from home + internet subsidy100% English environmentRequirements:
3+ years of experience as a Salesforce Business Analyst, Functional Analyst, or similar role.1+ years of hands-on experience with Salesforce Health Cloud.Strong understanding of healthcare workflows and patient engagement processes.Ability to gather, document, and prioritize business and technical requirements.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a focus on user experience.3-5 years of SQL experience for extracting, transforming, and analyzing patient and operational dataStrong communication and storytelling skills to convey data findings in a patient-centered, outcome-oriented contextFamiliarity with healthcare data structures such as claims data (LAAD, Optum, etc.), pharmacy data, and outreach data (Salesforce)Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.G., Tableau, Looker, Power BI) to create clear, accessible dashboards and reportsExperience collaborating with cross-functional teams including patient advocates, digital health product managers, patient services managersProficiency with Excel/Google Sheets for ad hoc analyses and quick-turn reportingDetail-oriented mindset with the ability to work independentlyAs a team member you will:
